Delaney on 1/21/2015 VACATING the 12/4/2013 findings and recommendations  632  and RECOMMENDING  that petitioner's claims 2, 3, 25, and 37 be denied because  the CA Supre me Court's rejection of those claims was not contrary to law or  unreasonable as defined in 28 U.S.C. § 2254(d); the allegations in   petitioner's claims 4, 5, and 7 that were the subject of the evidentiary   hearing ordered previously  be denied because the CA Supreme Court's rejection   of those claims was not contrary to law or unreasonable as defined in 28 U.S.C. § 2254(d); the evidentiary hearing proceedings on petitioner's  claims 28 and 29 resume because the C A Supreme Court's denial of those claims  was contrary to law or unreasonable as defined by 28 U.S.C. § 2254(d); the  allegations in petitioner's claim 42 that Juror Fairfield committed misconduct  by communicating with her minister be  denied on the merits; petitioner's claim 44 be denied on the merits; petitioner' s November 5, 2010 Motion to Expand the Record and for an Evidentiary Hearing on Claim 37 (ECF No.   549   ) be denied. Referred to Judge Kimberly J. Mueller;  within 30 days, any party may file supplemental objections to the portions of these  amended findings and recommendations that differ from the 12/4/2013 findings and recommendations.(Yin, K)
